text: This code should work for any blog. It is just included by default in the boilerplate. If you want it in another template you need to add it
hey all, has anyone had issues with the post-formatter not using the macro for `related_blog_posts` tag?
you can change with put css class on the container and then with javascript change the title attribute from that cta you inside in the code. <@UFCK510Q6>
$(".your-class-name span span span a").attr("title","your custom title or put in blank");

i think you can see this article and then , put all into a container with a class custom, and then only change the css in your code and that it, with that would be work <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/menus-and-navigation#the-hubl-simple-menu-tag>
you can try only put in the menu the 3 links more small font, and before that, put your custom hubl code or html for the title column <@UUH4PHFEJ>
